Description: Fragment of a furnishing textile in undyed linen plain weave with loop decoration (c.4.5cm long/1 every 7 picks); c.1.8cm from the loops is a large tapestry square has been applied and sewn (22.5x24cm); the tapestry is in undyed linen and yellow and purple wool, the wool is now mostly missing and makes the iconography difficult to read; the central medallion is decorated by a purple lion? running to the left; this medallion is surrounded by yellow bands and a freize of beige dots on a purple background; the corner of the square were decorated by vine leaves and four L-shaped freizes of stylised interlacing in flying threads on a purple background; the square is framed with a freize of purple finials; plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/18), weft-undyed linen (S/12); tapestry on grouped threads: warp-undyed linen (S/5), weft-undyed linen (S/40), yellow and purple wool (S/52); flying threads: undyed linen and undyed wool (S); sewing: undyed linen (S spun Z ply); all edges cut
Curator's comments: stored in black box; kept with small bag of extra loops
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
